title: Implement A Utility Mapping Study (Adolescent AQoL-6D Example)
text: Youth mental health services typically collect health utility data clients, makes difficult place economic values outcomes attained services. One strategy addressing gap use data similar samples young people contain health utility types outcome measures collected clinical services. TTU package provides toolkit conducting reporting utility mapping (Transfer Utility) study.

title: Implement A Utility Mapping Study (Adolescent AQoL-6D Example)
text: TTU developed use ready4 model combines extends multiple types ready4 modules: Modules labeling, validating summarising youth mental health datasets youthvars package; Modules scoring health utility scorz package; Modules specifying testing statistical models specific package; Modules generating reports ready4show package; Modules sharing data via online data repositories ready4use package. Additionally, TTU relies two RMarkdown programs: ttu_mdl_ctlg: Generate Template Utility Mapping (Transfer Utility) Model Catalogue (https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5936870) ttu_lng_ss: Create Draft Scientific Manuscript Utility Mapping Study (https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5976987)

title: Implement A Utility Mapping Study (Adolescent AQoL-6D Example)
text: following workflow illustrates (using fake data) steps used real world study, summary available https://doi.org/10.1101/2021.07.07.21260129). Citation information study : program applied study, workflow closely resembles available https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.6116077 can cited follows:
code: @article {Hamilton2021.07.07.21260129,     author = {Hamilton, Matthew P and Gao, Caroline X and Filia, Kate M and Menssink, Jana M and Sharmin, Sonia and Telford, Nic and Herrman, Helen and Hickie, Ian B and Mihalopoulos, Cathrine and Rickwood, Debra J and McGorry, Patrick D and Cotton, Sue M},     title = {Predicting Quality Adjusted Life Years in young people attending primary mental health services},     elocation-id = {2021.07.07.21260129},     year = {2021},     doi = {10.1101/2021.07.07.21260129},     publisher = {Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory Press},     URL = {https://www.medrxiv.org/content/early/2021/07/12/2021.07.07.21260129},     eprint = {https://www.medrxiv.org/content/early/2021/07/12/2021.07.07.21260129.full.pdf},     journal = {medRxiv} } @software{hamilton_matthew_2022_6212704,   author       = {Hamilton, Matthew and                   Gao, Caroline},   title        = {{Complete study program to reproduce all steps from                     data ingest through to results dissemination for a                    study to map mental health measures to AQoL-6D                    health utility}},   month        = feb,   year         = 2022,   note         = {{Matthew Hamilton and Caroline Gao  (2022).                     Complete study program to reproduce all steps from                    data ingest through to results dissemination for a                    study to map mental health measures to AQoL-6D                    health utility. Zenodo.                    https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.6116077. Version                    0.0.9.3}},   publisher    = {Zenodo},   version      = {0.0.9.3},   doi          = {10.5281/zenodo.6212704},   url          = {https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.6212704} }

title: Implement A Utility Mapping Study (Adolescent AQoL-6D Example)
text: begin loading required packages.
code: library(ready4) library(ready4show) library(ready4use) library(youthvars) library(scorz) library(TTU)

title: Implement A Utility Mapping Study (Adolescent AQoL-6D Example)
text: default, methods associated TTU modules request consent writing files machine. safest option. However, many files need written locally program execute, can overwrite default supplying value “Y” methods consent_1L_chr argument.
code: consent_1L_chr <- "" # Default value - asks for consent prior to writing each file.

title: Implement A Utility Mapping Study (Adolescent AQoL-6D Example)
text: use Ready4useDyad Ready4useRepos modules retrieve ingest pair dataset data dictionary. use YouthvarsSeries module supply metadata longitudinal dataset vignette.
code: A <- Ready4useDyad(ds_tb = Ready4useRepos(dv_nm_1L_chr = "fakes", dv_ds_nm_1L_chr = "https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/HJXYKQ", dv_server_1L_chr = "dataverse.harvard.edu") %>%                      ingest(fls_to_ingest_chr = c("ymh_clinical_tb"), metadata_1L_lgl = F) %>% youthvars::transform_raw_ds_for_analysis(),                    dictionary_r3 = Ready4useRepos(dv_nm_1L_chr = "TTU", dv_ds_nm_1L_chr = "https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/DKDIB0", dv_server_1L_chr = "dataverse.harvard.edu") %>%                      ingest(fls_to_ingest_chr = c("dictionary_r3"), metadata_1L_lgl = F)) %>%   renew(type_1L_chr = "label") A <- YouthvarsSeries(a_Ready4useDyad = A, id_var_nm_1L_chr = "fkClientID", timepoint_var_nm_1L_chr = "round",                      timepoint_vals_chr = levels(procureSlot(A, "ds_tb")$round))

title: Implement A Utility Mapping Study (Adolescent AQoL-6D Example)
text: next use ScorzAqol6Adol module score adolescent AQoL-6D health utility.
code: A <- TTUProject(a_ScorzProfile = ScorzAqol6Adol(a_YouthvarsProfile = A)) A <- renew(A, what_1L_chr = "utility") ## Joining with `by = join_by(fkClientID, match_var_chr)`

title: Implement A Utility Mapping Study (Adolescent AQoL-6D Example)
text: next steps use modules specific package specify assess number candidate utility mapping models.

title: Implement A Utility Mapping Study (Adolescent AQoL-6D Example)
text: begin specifying parameters use modelling project. initial step ensure fields storing parameter values internally consistent data entered previous steps. next ingest lookup table metadata variables plan explore candidate predictors. case, sourcing lookup table online data repository. can inspect metadata candidate predictors just ingested. add additional metadata variables dataset used exploratory modelling. record data working fake (step can skipped working real data). update internal consistency values previously supplied create local workspace output files written. now generate tables charts describe dataset. saved sub-directory output data directory, available download. One plots also reproduced .  next compare performance different model types. perform step using investigate method. first several times use method. time method called updated next time method called, different algorithm used. sequence calls investigate therefore important (order outlined example attempt repeat call investigate redo prior step). outputs previous command saved sub-directory output directory. example output available download). inspect output, can specify preferred model types use point onwards. Next assess multiple versions preferred model type - one single predictor model candidate predictors models candidate covariates added. previous step saved output sub-directory output directory. Example output available download: (single predictor comparisons) multivariate model comparisons. reviewing output, can specify covariates wish add models assess point forward. can now assess multivariate models. result previous step, model objects plot files saved sub-directory output directory. Examples output available download . inspect output can reformulate models finalised previous step suitable modelling longitudinal change. primary analysis, use mixed model formulation models previously selected. series large model files written local output data directory. secondary analyses, specify alternative combinations predictors covariates.
code: A <- renew(A, what_1L_chr = "parameters") A <- renew(A, "use_renew_mthd", fl_nm_1L_chr = "predictors_r3", type_1L_chr = "predictors_lup",             y_Ready4useRepos = Ready4useRepos(dv_nm_1L_chr = "TTU", dv_ds_nm_1L_chr = "https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/DKDIB0",                                               dv_server_1L_chr = "dataverse.harvard.edu"),            what_1L_chr = "parameters") exhibit(A, scroll_box_args_ls = list(width = "100%")) A <- renew(A, c(0.03,1), type_1L_chr = "range", what_1L_chr = "parameters") %>%   renew(c("BADS","GAD7", "K6", "OASIS", "PHQ9", "SCARED"),         type_1L_chr = "predictors_vars", what_1L_chr = "parameters") %>%   renew(c("d_sex_birth_s", "d_age",  "d_sexual_ori_s", "d_studying_working", "c_p_diag_s", "c_clinical_staging_s", "SOFAS"),              type_1L_chr = "covariates", what_1L_chr = "parameters") %>%   renew(c("d_age","Gender","d_relation_s", "d_sexual_ori_s" ,"Region", "d_studying_working", "c_p_diag_s", "c_clinical_staging_s","SOFAS"),          type_1L_chr = "descriptives", what_1L_chr = "parameters") %>%   renew("d_interview_date", type_1L_chr = "temporal", what_1L_chr = "parameters") A <- renew(A, T, type_1L_chr = "is_fake", what_1L_chr = "parameters") A <- renew(A, consent_1L_chr = consent_1L_chr, paths_chr = tempdir(), what_1L_chr = "project") A <- author(A, consent_1L_chr = consent_1L_chr, digits_1L_int = 3L, what_1L_chr = "descriptives") A <- investigate(A, consent_1L_chr = consent_1L_chr, depnt_var_max_val_1L_dbl = 0.9999, session_ls = sessionInfo()) A <- renew(A, c("GLM_GSN_LOG", "OLS_CLL"), type_1L_chr = "models", what_1L_chr = "results") A <- investigate(A, consent_1L_chr = consent_1L_chr) A <- renew(A, "SOFAS", type_1L_chr = "covariates", what_1L_chr = "results") A <- investigate(A, consent_1L_chr = consent_1L_chr) A <- investigate(A, consent_1L_chr = consent_1L_chr) A <- investigate(A, consent_1L_chr = consent_1L_chr,                  scndry_anlys_params_ls = make_scndry_anlys_params(candidate_predrs_chr = c("SOFAS"),                                                                    candidate_covar_nms_chr = c("d_sex_birth_s", "d_age", "d_sexual_ori_s", "d_studying_working"),                                                                    prefd_covars_chr = NA_character_) %>%                    make_scndry_anlys_params(candidate_predrs_chr = c("SCARED","OASIS","GAD7"),                                             candidate_covar_nms_chr = c("PHQ9", "SOFAS", "d_sex_birth_s", "d_age", "d_sexual_ori_s", "d_studying_working"),                                             prefd_covars_chr = "PHQ9"))

title: Implement A Utility Mapping Study (Adolescent AQoL-6D Example)
text: model objects created saved working directory preceding steps suitable public dissemination. large file size , importantly, include copies source dataset. can overcome limitations creating shareable versions models. Two types shareable version created - copies original model objects fake data overwrites original source data summary tables model coefficients.
code: A <- author(A, consent_1L_chr = consent_1L_chr, what_1L_chr = "models")

title: Implement A Utility Mapping Study (Adolescent AQoL-6D Example)
text: update can begin use render share reports. add metadata relevant reports generating fields. Note data supply Ready4useRepos object must relate repository write permissions (otherwise subsequent steps fail).
code: A <- renew(A, what_1L_chr = "reporting") A <- renew(A, ready4show::authors_tb, type_1L_chr = "authors", what_1L_chr = "reporting") %>%   renew(ready4show::institutes_tb, type_1L_chr = "institutes", what_1L_chr = "reporting") %>%   renew(c(3L,3L), type_1L_chr = "digits", what_1L_chr = "reporting") %>%   renew(c("PDF","PDF"), type_1L_chr = "formats", what_1L_chr = "reporting") %>%   renew("A hypothetical utility mapping study using fake data", type_1L_chr = "title", what_1L_chr = "reporting") %>%   renew(renew(ready4show_correspondences(), old_nms_chr = c("PHQ9", "GAD7"), new_nms_chr = c("PHQ-9", "GAD-7")), type_1L_chr = "changes", what_1L_chr = "reporting") %>%   renew(Ready4useRepos(dv_nm_1L_chr = "fakes", dv_ds_nm_1L_chr = "https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/D74QMP", dv_server_1L_chr = "dataverse.harvard.edu"), type_1L_chr = "repos", what_1L_chr = "reporting")

title: Implement A Utility Mapping Study (Adolescent AQoL-6D Example)
text: download program generating catalogue models use summarising models created study analysis (one primary two secondary). catalogues saved locally.
code: A <- author(A, consent_1L_chr = consent_1L_chr, download_tmpl_1L_lgl = T, what_1L_chr = "catalogue")

title: Implement A Utility Mapping Study (Adolescent AQoL-6D Example)
text: add content manuscript wish author. create brief summary results can interpreted program authors manuscript. create save plots used manuscript. download program generating template manuscript run author first draft manuscript. can copy RMarkdown files created template manuscript new directory (called “Manuscript_Submission”) can manually edit files produce manuscript can submit publication. point workflow, additional steps required adapt / author manuscript submitted publication. However, example going skip step keep working unedited template manuscript. finalised manuscript authoring program stored online, now specify repository program can retrieved. can now configure output generated manuscript authoring program. commands specify Microsoft Word format manuscript PDF technical appendix. Unlike template manuscript, figures tables positioned (within) main body manuscript. Note Word version manuscript generated values require minor formatting edits (principally display tables numbering sections). edits RMarkdown files creating submission manuscript finalised, can run following command author manuscript. using custom manuscript authoring program downloaded online repository download_tmpl_1L_lgl argument need set T. can now generate Supplementary Information submission manuscript.
code: A <- renew(A, "Quality Adjusted Life Years (QALYs) are often used in economic evaluations, yet utility weights for deriving them are rarely directly measured in mental health services.",             type_1L_chr = "background", what_1L_chr = "reporting") %>%   renew("None declared", type_1L_chr = "conflicts", what_1L_chr = "reporting") %>%   renew("Nothing should be concluded from this study as it is purely hypothetical.", type_1L_chr = "conclusion", what_1L_chr = "reporting") %>%   renew("The study was reviewed and granted approval by no-one." , type_1L_chr = "ethics", what_1L_chr = "reporting") %>%   renew("The study was funded by no-one.", type_1L_chr = "funding", what_1L_chr = "reporting") %>%   renew("three months", type_1L_chr = "interval", what_1L_chr = "reporting") %>%   renew(c("anxiety", "AQoL","depression", "psychological distress", "QALYs", "utility mapping"), type_1L_chr = "keywords", what_1L_chr = "reporting") %>%   renew("The study sample is fake data.", type_1L_chr = "sample", what_1L_chr = "reporting") A <- renew(A, c("AQoL-6D", "Adolescent AQoL Six Dimension"), type_1L_chr = "naming", what_1L_chr = "reporting") A <- renew(A, "use_renew_mthd", type_1L_chr = "abstract", what_1L_chr = "reporting") A <- author(A, consent_1L_chr = consent_1L_chr, what_1L_chr = "plots") A <- author(A, consent_1L_chr = consent_1L_chr, download_tmpl_1L_lgl = T, what_1L_chr = "manuscript") A <- author(A, consent_1L_chr = consent_1L_chr, type_1L_chr = "copy", what_1L_chr = "manuscript") # Not run # A <- renew(A, c("URL of GitHub repository with", "Program version number"), type_1L_chr = "template-manuscript", what_1L_chr = "reporting") A <- renew(A, F, type_1L_chr = "figures-body", what_1L_chr = "reporting") %>%   renew(F, type_1L_chr = "tables-body", what_1L_chr = "reporting") %>%   renew(c("Word","PDF"), type_1L_chr = "formats", what_1L_chr = "reporting") A <- author(A, consent_1L_chr = consent_1L_chr, download_tmpl_1L_lgl = F, type_1L_chr="submission", what_1L_chr = "manuscript") A <- author(A, consent_1L_chr = consent_1L_chr, supplement_fl_nm_1L_chr = "TA_PDF", type_1L_chr="submission", what_1L_chr = "supplement")
